This time it's time for a small set form a LEGO Star Wars Magazine.

Model

Boba Fett's ship Slave I, also known as a Flying Iron, appears in magazine fo the first time. Model is small, yet nicely designed. It contain all it has to have. We get in here a small, little bit angular canopy. Well known tail with cannon mounted at an end. Wings, unfortunately cannot be pose, but are made well, and it's attaching point is hidden very nice. Whole shape of the hull is remake great with usage of two big elements in dark red. On the backs we can see nothing unfortunately. LEGO hasn't gave us some additional studs to make engines. Overall it looks pretty good. Big plus is for sure fact, that You stand put it on it's tail and it wouldn't fall.

Building process was really easy and straight forward, nothing fancy. Instruction takes little less than one A4 sheet of paper.

Parts

In this rather small set we get 31 pieces. It means more less same amount as in other sets.

Worth noticed big amount of bricks in kinda rare colors. We get bricks in New Dark Red, Tan and Sand Green. A inclusions of studs with handle in LBG is worth pointing out. As it is very often, in this type of sets value of parts is high above the value of model.

Summary

  • Model looks really nice, is designed with big amount of clearness.
  • It can stand on its own in vertical position.
  • Lack of engines and poseable wings.
  • Lot of bricks in rare colors and useful shapes.

Over all I think it is worth buying. It is worth 3.5 stars.

Hope this review was helpful.
